rulings.f44e791a2c5e: Provides only ony maneuver each combat, even if the bearer changes. [LSJ 19980302-2]

rulings.37346378032c: Cannot be played when burned as a result of a Blood Hunt referendum. [LSJ 20070417]

rulings.cf65825f421b: Cannot be used to prevent damage that cannot be prevented by cards that require Fortitude. [LSJ 19990216]

rulings.afe0462f745c: The pool loss occurs if the block would be successful, even if the action is ended (eg. {Change of Target} or {Obedience}) or made unblockable ({Horrific Countenance}) at this point. [RTR 19991206] [LSJ 20091125]

rulings.f99a55e6c49a: If you play Agent of Power on a vampire and that vampire plays a {Dual Form} at superior [PRO], the Dual Form gains the Discipline provided by the Agent of Power and keeps it once the Agent of Power burns. [LSJ 20071005-1]

rulings.6fa307e0cdcb: An action cannot continue "as if unblocked" after a combat resulting from a successful action. [RTR 19970630]
rulings.4537a42e7817: "continue as if unblocked" moves the action card from the ash heap (where it went when the action was blocked) to limbo (where it should be if the action is not blocked). If the action card is not in the ash heap, then the action cannot be continued. [LSJ 20070808-1]

rulings.7d0a8a69c584: The vampire needs not pay a blood if he successfully blocks, even if the action continues as if unblocked after the block (eg. {Form of Mist}). [LSJ 20070417]

rulings.43b0394b9d7e: Can be used to unlock if the action is unblocked, even if it has no effect due to lack of a suitable target. [LSJ 20070411]
rulings.261246861321: [DOM] Can be played against a target with 10 or more pool and does not count against the limit in this case: it will only have a lingering effect (+3 bleed if the target happens to have 9 or less). [PIB 20110817]
rulings.6b5197850ff4: [DOM] When played against a target with 10 or more pool, it can be played alongside another bleed modifier that counts against the limit, and it would provide its +3 bonus in addition to that other bleed modifier if the target happens to have 9 or less. [PIB 20110817]
rulings.ce220131ada6: May be used anytime it is unlocked, even if it has been used previously during the same action (it must be unlocked by some method, of course). [TOM 19960109]
rulings.fbc72c5e6ff9: [PRO] If the action continues "as if unblocked", all action modifiers and reaction cards are still in effect, even those pertaining to a successful block. [RTR 19941109] [ANK 20190116]
rulings.5bb45da72c8e: [PRO] If the action continues "as if unblocked", Methusalah that had declined to block before do not get another opportunity to block. [ANK 20190116]
rulings.ff9060e9a8db: [PRO] An action cannot continue "as if unblocked" after a combat resulting from a successful action. [RTR 19970630]
rulings.f2e511ff6ebf: [PRO] "continue as if unblocked" moves the action card from the ash heap (where it went when the action was blocked) to limbo (where it should be if the action is not blocked). If the action card is not in the ash heap, then the action cannot be continued. [LSJ 20070808-1]
rulings.c61af0f638e5: [PRO] If the combat continues or a new combat begins, the "action continues as if unblocked" effect is lost and the blood is not paid. [LSJ 19980109] [RTR 20020501] [LSJ 20031123]
rulings.0cfa4243638e: Cannot be used if there is no equipment to destroy. [RTR 19980928]

rulings.fc5ce3356596: Are not mortal, are a monster. [ANK 20200203-2]

rulings.fac5935e5acf: The vampire must take the action directed at a vampire, even if no vampire has any blood left. [LSJ 19970224]
rulings.c4d79e5f4f97: When hunting on a target that has no blood to steal, the hunt action will simply have no effect, stealing zero blood. [LSJ 19970224]
rulings.f522ad84e951: The vampire cannot hunt if there are no vampires at all. [LSJ 19970224]
rulings.c4eda45e0f11: If the vampire with the card "cannot gain blood", then the stolen blood is moved to the blood bank when he hunts. [LSJ 20010809-1]
rulings.9591e196a607: Cannot choose to target a vampire when using another non-standard hunt action (eg. {Abactor}). [LSJ 20090606] [ANK 20190707]
rulings.b2862a92aec3: Multiple copies in play give only 1 vote in total to non-titled Panders. [LSJ 20010819] [PIB 20130722]
rulings.ed62d1dadb4f: May be used if one of your vampires is in combat with an ally. In this case, your vampire goes into torpor and the ally is unaffected. [RTR 19960112]
rulings.f0c89b55dff4: Is played during combat. Combat cards can be played to continue combat or begin a new combat. [ANK 20200109]
rulings.a37538ef9425: If the combat continues or a new combat begins (eg. {Psyche!}), the vampires do not go into torpor. [RTR 20020501] [LSJ 20021126]
rulings.8f48d681e402: Cannot be used on a vampire who merged last turn: merging is not entering play. [LSJ 20030519-2]
rulings.62666fab6578: Effects that depend on the successful block do not see the block as successful. [RTR 20080808]
rulings.ccb4d7aeaa20: The additional cost does not apply once the minion has failed to block, so it does not apply to the cost of the action card. [LSJ 20080818]
rulings.44cc58fb1282: If a player is saved more than once by Life Boon, the various Boons reserve a series of victory points, rather than competing with each other for a single victory point. [RTR 19951017]
rulings.58a48a3ed034: If a player has gone to negative pool, the Life Boon player must give her enough pool to compensate for that. [RTR 19970630]
rulings.dc156fc95fe1: If the target receives half of a victory point, then the Methuselah who played the Boon receives that half. The Boon is not burned until a total of one victory point has been awarded. [RTR 19991206]
rulings.c140afeb2ecb: If the effect ousting the target simultaneously ousts the target's prey (eg. {Kine Resources Contested}), the victory point goes to the Mathusalah who played Life Boon and the target gets 6 pool. [LSJ 20021029]
rulings.6ab9616d7b12: Can be locked when the action is announced or when the cost is paid. [ANK 20170605]
rulings.c4b28fc9d9f6: Can be used to reduce the cost in blood of a recruit ally (eg. {Shambling Hordes}) or employ retainer action. [ANK 20181007]
rulings.1aa526621f58: Cannot be used by an ally acting "as a vampire". [ANK 20200605]
rulings.c345ba1e8445: Is not playable if you have less than 7 cards in your library. [LSJ 20070901]
rulings.c8169714744e: Once in play, applies to an action if any one of its targets would be enough to enable his effect. [LSJ 20080809-2] [KOT 20081119]

rulings.e2e7248f8a79: You cannot use another strike card as the hand strike for Lucky Blow. [LSJ 20010627]

rulings.7f69289f6281: If the minion it is on has entered combat and unlocks, he is free to take any other action. [ANK 20200227]

rulings.c6d0f459e20d: Does not count as using the weapon: no restriction nor side-effect apply. [LSJ 20010806-1]

rulings.73500403acda: [MEL] Will have no effect if the vampire who played it abstains, even if he is forced to abstain. The effect operates on the final disposition of the vampire's votes at the time the votes are tallied. [LSJ 20020123]
rulings.2f840f0d3530: [MEL] When used as an action modifier, the acting vampire gains one blood if he does not abstain, as he can only vote in agreement with himself. [LSJ 20020123]

rulings.a823ab5905c7: The equipment need not be declared, it is chosen upon resolution. [PIB 20150315]
rulings.545ef410eb7c: [PRE] The vampire still unlocks if an effect continues the combat or begins a new combat. [RTR 20020501]

rulings.27334f30e996: Cannot be played in succession. The loss from the play of a Major Boon is due to a card effect, not a bleed. So a second cannot be played to Boon the first. [RTR 19960530]
rulings.bb00f5ae751d: Multiple Major Boons in play cannot be burned on the same bleed action - after the first is burned, "you" are no longer the Methuselah burning pool. [LSJ 19990218]
rulings.0741322769e4: Can be used by a locked vampire. [PIB 20150720] [RTR 19941109]
rulings.ac53b33aba4e: Cannot be used by a vampire in torpor. [PIB 20150720] [RTR 19970306]
rulings.4a60097a0ede: Does not require control of a ready Malkavian. [RTR 19951124]

rulings.fff0f3a7d316: Modifier and reactions that can be used at the end/after an action can still be used after the action fails. [LSJ 20041022]

rulings.837ce6d47aec: Can be burned during an action that targets only part of the Methusalah that were targeted by the first action. [LSJ 20100527]
rulings.cbd80b0ef717: Can be used by a vampire in torpor. [LSJ 20020416]
rulings.92a1a17efb9d: Can be played by a minion of a Methusalah not involved in the current combat. [ANK 20181101]

rulings.1ae76af5d2da: Cannot be used to take over an action granted by an equipment the masked minion has, even if the masking vampire also has the same equipment. [LSJ 20020926]

rulings.2fdddb22c5db: Must announce which conviction he burns as part of the terms of the action granted by his ability. [RTR 20111202]
rulings.242fe9998a66: If the master card is not replaced immediately (eg. {Wash}), you look at then hand without the replacement card. [ANK 20180512]
rulings.5180ec300bf5: The additional blood cost is not paid if the action does not succeed. [PIB 20121031]
rulings.01b57d1ff471: Card with disciplines choices (eg. [vis]/[tha]) are considered of the discipline they are played as. [PIB 20150924-2]
rulings.6034d86625f8: Can still defect if in torpor, and will remain in torpor if he does so. [RTR 19941109]
rulings.4f657672f57b: The prohibition to play certain cards applies from the moment he attempts to block until the end of the action, even if he fails to block. [LSJ 20080818]
rulings.572e614f095a: When playing a card requiring a Camarilla vampire or a Prince, he is treated as a such for all effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. He is not treated as such for effects the card has from being in play. [ANK 20190228]
rulings.16665af37f03: His "as he enters play" ability can be used before he enters contest (not after) if there is another one in play. [LSJ 20080526] [LSJ 20100902]
rulings.50e285c19f07: When meeting a requirement to play a card, he is treated as such for all the effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. He is not treated as meeting the requirements for effects the card has from being in play. [ANK 20200703-3] [ANK 20190228] [LSJ 20101013]
rulings.a2d41998b2b6: If a card he plays is cancelled as it is played, he is still considered having used the requirement, if any. [ANK 20200710]
rulings.566190528ea2: He can meet any title as well as non-requirements (eg. non-Red List), but cannot meet requirements that are not vampire traits (eg. Mortal, unlocked, older, ..) [LSJ 20081120-1]
rulings.197f08326370: When meeting a title requirement, he is considered as a vampire of the underlying sect. [LSJ 20050128]
rulings.71c36f6e593e: He can meet the requirements for his controller to play any card, including Master cards. [LSJ 20091015] [PIB 20130128]
rulings.304905ae9d9f: He cannot fulfill a non-vampire trait requirement (eg. Gehenna), but he can fulfill the "Red List" or "Flight" requirements. [LSJ 20091016]
rulings.011d124b8042: Striga and Maleficia are not vampire traits. [LSJ 20100226]
rulings.585d3f14b8ab: When playing a card requiring a title or a sect, he is treated as a such for all effects of the card, including duration effects. [ANK 20190228] [LSJ 20101013]
rulings.a21adbbafdd4: He can use a card in play as if he had a title or a sect, but cannot use it if it would provide unrequired stealth or intercept (eg. he cannot use {No Secrets From the Magaji} to attempt to block a vampire acting with no stealth). [ANK 20180403]
rulings.8c57a5eb0244: When meeting a requirement, the controller can choose how he meets it (eg. he can play {Anarch Secession} as a Prince of any city, even a made-up one). [PIB 20150306] [PIB 20150307]
rulings.fe8bc543fd80: He can use a card requiring a sect or titled to be played (eg. use {Abbot} intercept bonus as a Sabbat vampire, perform {Archon} action to burn it as a Prince or Justicar). [PIB 20150306]
rulings.a30a6409294d: He cannot use a card as a vampire of a sect or with a title if the card does not require the sect or title to be played. (eg. he cannot benefit from {Powerbase: Madrid} as a Sabbat vampire) [PIB 20150306]
rulings.d6b2a90750d3: His special ability only affects the cost of masters played by his controller. [LSJ 20081124-1]
rulings.36980be830ee: His ability to end combat can be used when he is in torpor. [LSJ 20011022]
rulings.6c85a7976131: When recruit a changeling ally, he is treated as a meeting the requirements for all effects of the card, and only them, including duration effects. He is not treated as meeting the requirements for effects the card has from being in play. [ANK 20190228]
rulings.64ba9435d0dd: His ability do not let him fulfill card requirements if they are not played normally, like when using {Piper}. [LSJ 20050119]
rulings.3075ea4bebc4: Is not titled. If he gets a title, his additional votes are added to the ones provided by the title. [LSJ 20100601]
rulings.70801740f48e: [MERGED] Is Anarch Black Hand Seraph. If the base version was the one in play, it changes sect as it is merged. [ANK 20180524] [LSJ 20031121-3]
